image.altText: A man holds a bunch of bridles.

props.synopsis: An independent stewards panel charges leading Tasmanian harness trainer Ben Yole, his brother and two harness drivers under the Australian Harness Racing Rules.

title.children: Long-awaited racing stewards report charges leading horse trainer Ben Yole and others

image.altText: An ambulance team loads a stretcher into the van

props.synopsis: Gunmen have killed at least six people in Tel Aviv, and Iran says it has launched some 200 missiles at Israel.

title.children: At least six killed in suspected Tel Aviv terror attack as Iran reports firing 200 missiles at Israel

image.altText: The flags of Iran Lebanon and Hezbollah

props.synopsis: The missile strikes on Israel is the latest in a series of escalations in the Middle East and, unlike Iran's previous retaliation, could see the situation devolve further in a region on the brink.

title.children: In a fortnight of escalations, the Iran missile attack on Israel is unlikely to be the last one

image.altText: A animation of four different plans showing a zone moving and changing in size.

props.synopsis: There were once plans for a nation-leading reconciliation space at Hobart's Macquarie Point. But over time, the space has shrunk â€” and will now shrink again because of cricket pitches and the Goods Shed.

title.children: How the Aboriginal zone for Hobart's Macquarie Point has moved and shrunk

image.altText: Jenny Moncur sits at a table and looks at her mobile phone

props.synopsis: Consumers and industry stakeholders are calling for better regulation of phone companies after family members of deceased customers are repeatedly contacted â€“ in some cases for years after a person's death.

title.children: 'Telstra has got away with it': Widow's 'unforgivable' ordeal over her dead husband's account

image.altText: A Virgin plane flying in the sky in Brisbane.

props.synopsis: After Qantas successfully lobbied against extra Qatar Airways flights, the Middle Eastern airline has exacted revenge on the Flying Kangaroo with a deal that will increase competition and possibly result in cheaper fares.

title.children: How Qatar outmanoeuvred Qantas on international flights

image.altText: A run down brick property, with a rusty roof

props.synopsis: A run-down convict building was bequeathed to Tasmania's Heritage Council. Following the council's decision to pass on the property, it was snapped up by the then-deputy chair â€” now an investigation is underway.

title.children: This historical site was bequeathed to the Heritage Council, refused, then bought privately by the council's deputy chair

image.altText: A shopfront with flowers for sale

props.synopsis: Cost of living pressures are being felt right across the world, and Australia is no different. But how do the cost of our groceries actually compare?

title.children: Grocery prices compared between Australia, UK, NZ and Ireland â€” who comes out on top?

image.altText: Guest facilities at the St Pancras Renaissance Hotel London.

props.synopsis: Staff from a Tasmanian agency charged with "attracting investment" to the state have racked up international hotel stays and other expenses amounting to $289,000 over the past three financial years.

title.children: Did you miss? ðŸ“£ Five-star hotel stays detailed in spending records of Tasmania's Coordinator-General Office

image.altText: Night shot of apartment buildings with smoke rising from a blast

props.synopsis: Iran has fired about 200 missiles at Israel in response to the killings of senior leaders of Hamas, Hezbollah and the Iranian Revolutionary Guards. Israel's military says the attack will have consequences. Follow live

title.children: Netanyahu says Iran 'will pay' for missile attacks as Israeli air strikes hit Lebanon's capital

image.altText: A rally for Gaza and Lebanon in Sydney

props.synopsis: Organisers says pro-Palestinian events will go ahead in Sydney this weekend even if they are prohibited by the NSW Supreme Court as Prime Minister Anthony Albanese backs NSW Police's attempts to prevent them happening.

title.children: Pro-Palestinian events will go ahead in Sydney even if prohibited by court, organisers say

image.altText: Traffic driving along street at a new housing estate.

props.synopsis: News that Treasury was looking at modelling changes to negative gearing was treated as a scandal. But when it comes to Australia's housing affordability problem, wouldn't the real scandal be if Treasury officials WEREN'T examining every possible pullable lever?

title.children: The flawed truth about the latest negative gearing outrage

image.altText: JD Vance (left) stands at a podium next to Tim Walz (right) who is also next to a podium.

props.synopsis: Democratic vice-presidential candidate Tim Walz and Republican vice-presidential candidate JD Vance have been clashing Â on many topics including climate change, abortion and gun violence. Follow live.

title.children: Tim Walz and JD Vance clash in US vice-presidential debate over guns, abortion, and immigration

image.altText: A man is led out of a house in handcuffs.

props.synopsis: Australian Federal Police allege the creator of Ghost app, used by criminals for communications had amassed millions in cryptocurrency.

title.children: Alleged Ghost app creator had millions in crypto, says AFP

image.altText: Kamindu Mendis raises his bat and helmet after a century

props.synopsis: After a decade in purgatory, Sri Lanka is once again rising up as a men's cricket powerhouse. Its revival is centred around Kamindu Mendis, an ambidextrous bowler who is now doing things not seen in generations with the bat.

title.children: One of cricket's slumbering giants is waking again, and this star's Bradman-style numbers are behind it

image.altText: Man in food manufacturing uniform pulling out a tray of pies.

props.synopsis: Adelaide bakery Vili's is about to renew its electricity contract and the cheapest quote will see them paying an extra $100,000 annually. It's forced the business to pass the rising costs on to their customers to stay afloat.

title.children: The electricity bill at this South Australian bakery just went up an extra $8,500 a month

image.altText: Richmond Tigers president John O'Rourke holding a media conference, speaking at the lecture, wearing a suit

props.synopsis: Richmond's president has taken a swipe at a departing quartet of premiership stars as megastar Dustin Martin shuts down speculation of coming out of retirement.

title.children: Richmond president takes swipe at leaving players, Martin says he will stay retired

image.altText: Sean 'Diddy' Combs

props.synopsis: An additional 120 people have come forward with sexual misconduct allegations against US rap mogul Sean "Diddy" Combs who is awaiting trial on sex trafficking charges.

title.children: 120 more alleged victims of Sean 'Diddy' Combs come forward to accuse rapper of sex crimes

image.altText: A shopping trolley full of essentials items like fruit, water, and eggs

props.synopsis: A US dock workers' strike reaching from New York to Texas is throwing global supply chains into disarray. And Australians' weekly shop will not be immune.

title.children: Why the weekly shop for many Australians could be impacted by a US dock worker strike

image.altText: A man with a short tight haircut and military uniform stands speaking.

props.synopsis: In candid remarks during last month's International Land Forces conference in Melbourne, visiting Brigadier General Frank J Lozano expressed confidence that a "coalition of the willing" could outpace Beijing's rising regional dominance.

title.children: Visiting US general warns 'there is a fight coming', as he stresses importance of Australian alliance

image.altText: a young noni hazlehurst reading a play school book on the set of the children's show

props.synopsis: Australian acting legend Noni Hazlehurst has had a varied and storied career. In an extract from her new memoir, Dropping the Mask, she reflects on how Play School shaped her into the person she is today.

title.children: Noni Hazlehurst has been on our stages, screens and radios since the 70s. But she's most proud of Play School

image.altText: A man looks at stock prices through the window of the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: Fears of an all out war in the Middle East are impacting financial markets.The Australian share market is flat with gains in mining and energy offset by losses in technology. Follow the day's events and insights as they happenÂ on the live markets blog.Â

title.children: ASX flat as Middle East conflict intensifies, while oil prices rise on the crisis

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Food and beverage companies to merge
ACCC warns of big box retailers getting 'significant market power'

image.altText: Close up of Julian Assange with him holding up a fist.

props.synopsis: Julian Assange is back on European soil. When last here, he was behind bars.

title.children: 'Isolation has taken its toll': Julian Assange in his first public appearance since his release from a UK prison

image.altText: Alisa Camplin holds a gold medal

props.synopsis: Aerial skiing great Alisa Camplin-Warner will be chef de mission for the Australian team at the 2026 Winter Olympics.

title.children: Aerials legend Alisa Camplin-Warner to lead Australia's winter Olympics charge

image.altText: An apartment building.

props.synopsis: As property prices continue to rise, real estate agents say they are seeing a large appetite for smaller, cheaper properties in Sydney.Â

title.children: For the average income earner, Sydney's west is the last remaining option to buy a home

image.altText: a woman smiling on a beach

props.synopsis: A new study investigating the link between sleep and pain could fundamentally change the way doctors and clinicians treat people with chronic pain.Â

title.children: New sleep study could be 'game-changer' for millions of Australians suffering from chronic pain

image.altText: Sold

props.synopsis: With negative gearing and capital gains tax back on the national agenda, experts say such reforms would be unlikely to lead to a major fall in property prices. But some investors say they could be forced to sell if there are changes to property tax breaks and that could force rents higher.Â

title.children: 'It's going to be very uncertain for us': Investors weigh in on negative gearing debate

image.altText: Fagan and cup

props.synopsis: Lions coach Chris Fagan has been spotted doing 'the most Brisbane thing ever' after taking the AFL premiership cup out during his morning walk for a coffee.

title.children: 'He had it wrapped in a towel': Lions coach Fagan spotted taking AFL cup for a walk in suburban Brisbane

image.altText: A baby hippo in her enclosure.

props.synopsis: After the viral fame of Thailand's new pygmy hippo, Taronga Zoo is hoping visitors will be enticed to see nine-month-old Lololi these school holidays.

title.children: Move over Moo Deng, Sydney's pygmy hippo calf Lololi is ready for her close up

image.altText: A red billboard featuring images of Shane King MP and Mark Ryan MP.

props.synopsis: Ahead of this month's state election, several MPs from both Labor and the LNP have used their electorate and communication allowances to pay for billboards spruiking themselves.

title.children: Queensland MPs use taxpayer-funded allowances to pay for billboards of themselves

image.altText: Tiny possum nestled within brown blanket

props.synopsis: A Victorian emblem â€” the lowland Leadbeater's possum â€” is dangerously close to extinction, with only a few dozen left in the wild in a small forest patch in the Yarra Ranges.

title.children: How 'future-proofing' Victoria's forests could help save the state's iconic emblem

image.altText: A woman in her 90s with a knife and fork, cutting into the cauliflower of her fish and vegetable dinner

props.synopsis: There are more benefits than just receiving food as Jean Jarvis says she enjoys connecting with the volunteers and ultimately keeping her independence.

title.children: Broken Hill's Meals on Wheels on brink of closure symptom of national volunteer shortage

image.altText: A man stands in front of a flowering canola field with a wind turbine in the background

props.synopsis: Across the country, wind farms are being built faster than ever, but agricultural landholders are split on embracing the energy revolution while protecting food production.

title.children: Wind turbines are on the horizon, but farmers are divided over whether it's a good thing

image.altText: A female jockey smiles after win on horse.

props.synopsis: Racing NSW says more women than ever are entering the sport of horse racing, invigorating a historically male-dominated industry.

title.children: No longer a 'sport of kings', female apprentices are dominating the racing industry

image.altText: A sign says 'my daughter should be as safe as my son, no more violence'

props.synopsis: When three women died â€” allegedly at the hands of men â€” in the regional town of Ballarat, the outpouring of anger that followed prompted more people to seek help.

title.children: Frontline responders fear Victoria's 'world-leading' action on family violence could cause further strain
